description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4cfo3","text":"This protocol outlines the methodology for isolating the peri-locus coeruleus (peri-LC) region in mice for subsequent single nucleus RNA profiling. Key steps include the preparation of NMDG-aCSF buffer with precise pH and osmolarity, careful euthanasia and extraction of the brain, and the use of a vibratome to obtain 300 Âµm thick slices. The peri-LC region is identified and isolated using a biopsy puncher, followed by immediate shock-freezing in liquid nitrogen to preserve tissue integrity. This approach facilitates high-quality RNA profiling, essential for understanding the molecular characteristics of the locus coeruleus and its surrounding regions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"29ukv","text":"Prepare the buffer a day before, and keep it in the fridge before using","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b3c29","text":"~ 500ml Milli-Q-Water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7jl6d","text":"add reagents of Table 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9hdod","text":"fill up until 1000 ml ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7ri3q","text":"sterile filter ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dptkq","text":"Bubble with 95% O2 and 5% CO2  until ph is stable (approx. 15-20 min) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ub2h","text":"adjust ph with HCl -\u003e must have: 7,3-7,4 pH, 315 mOsm  Can be stored at 4Â°C for a couple of days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"btli3","text":"On the day of the experiment add freshly: + 10,0 g Trehalose+ 50 Âµl (0,1 ÂµM) TTX+ 1 ml (200 ÂµM) DNQX+ 1 ml (50 ÂµM) APV+ 1 Âµg/ml actinomycin-d ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1gb8e","text":"Prepare NMDG-aCSF","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f68t1","text":"sterile filtered pH 7,3 ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2omen","text":"ðŸ¡ª Important between 7,3 and 7,4!! 300 mOsm after Trehalose ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djktq","text":"+ 10 mg/ 1L Trehalose ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tnvs","text":"Stir while bubbling with 5 % CO2 and 95 % O2. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnt4d","text":"for 15- 20 Min and check pH 7,3","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aep3j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bee76","text":"Clean EVERYTHING with RNase free!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2h945","text":"Prepare FALCON 3.1 Falcon with ACSF and FBS (0,5%)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc631","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"830g7","text":"Prepare chambers for recovery of brain slices ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fcvn","text":"When working with fluorescence labeled cells turn off light!","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":60}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ajehl","text":"Punch out brain areas with biopsy puncher (1.5 mm)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4nd1","text":"250 Âµl FBS + 50 ml aCSF ðŸ¡ª close with Parafilm to prevent gas leakage 3.2 Falcon with ACSF and Protease (1mg/ml) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"uui8","text":"30 mg Protease + 30 ml ACSF","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6as6t","text":"Place Instruments on a towel for dissection and trituration â†’ clean with RNase free","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a72j2","text":"Prepare Vibratome: new blade each time! ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"146sg","text":"80 Hz, 200 Frequency, Section: 300 Âµm (LEICA VT1200)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfrjt","text":"Fill Petri dish with NMDG-aCSF+FBS","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5l7t","text":" Place slices with pasteur pipette into petri dish","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eti9a","text":"Prepare Agaroseblock to assist vibrotome slicing and preventing pushing brain away during slicing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fcfb","text":"2% Agarose in Petri dish (fridge). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8epm","text":"Cut out small block approx. 1,5 cm â€“ 1,5 cm","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab9dn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4rgmq","text":"Chamber with NMDG-aCSF (RT): Recovery of Slices ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7kjak","text":"Chamber with RT NMDG-aCSF + Protease","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure of extracting brain and cutting brain stem slices
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dd031","text":" Euthanize mice with 0.1 ml pento or other approved euthanizing method","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure of extracting brain and cutting brain stem slices
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aeh0g","text":"Decapitate, remove skin, open scull (window)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure of extracting brain and cutting brain stem slices
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4067m","text":"Remove brain with spatula Block Brain (depending on region of interest (ROI) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure of extracting brain and cutting brain stem slices
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e4td3","text":"Glue agarose block to platform Place and glue brain in front of agarose block  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure of extracting brain and cutting brain stem slices
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ebcjl","text":"Place platform in vibratome, add ice cold NMDG-ACSF, bubble with 5Â % CO2 und 95 % O2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure of extracting brain and cutting brain stem slices
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ld82","text":"Vibratome: 80 Hz, Amplitude 200, section 300 Âµm, duration 0,10 mm/s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure of extracting brain and cutting brain stem slices
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fh1pr","text":"Discard brain slices until Locus coeruleus is reached ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure of extracting brain and cutting brain stem slices
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d11j0","text":"Place brain slices into ice-cold NMDG-ACSF bubble (5 % CO2 und 95 % O2) for 15 min Recovery","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"255q7","text":"If you immediately proceed with nuclei isolation, follow the protocol provided by the 10X Nuclei Isolation Kit (link)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":112,"length":4}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"33CE31B23D7543119E05293E6DFBD27D","url":"https://www.10xgenomics.com/support/single-cell-gene-expression/documentation/steps/sample-prep/chromium-nuclei-isolation-kit-sample-prep-user-guide"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3m1fs","text":"Place samples on ice until further usage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8solk","text":"In this image the LC is accumulating NM and iseasily visible. Landmarks such as the 4th vetricle can help you to locate LC and peri-LC region","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d45t0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqq8f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"DC2498B46AA411EFB48C0A58A9FEAC02","height":281,"id":499221,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2024-09-04 at 12.01.01.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/rffwbmmyf.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/rhsxbmmyf.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/rhswbmmyf.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9hdnc","text":"After punching the peri-LC region, store the tissue in a small PCR tube and immediately shock-freeze it in liquid nitrogen. Ensure the tissue is sent to collaborators as intact tissue, not as isolated nuclei.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":185,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10g0q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fivi8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tg1i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e5afm","text":"A biopsy tissue puncher with diameter of 1.5mm is recommended. We used biopuncher from Miltex (image copywrite Miltek/Tedpella  https://www.tedpella.com/histo_html/miltex-plunger-punch.aspx)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":128,"length":61}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"7D7856D6728011EFB0880A58A9FEAC02","height":175.77818181818182,"id":499223,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2024-09-14 at 12.02.22.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/rhstbmmyf.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/rhszbmmyf.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/rhsybmmyf.webp","width":177.71691176470588}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D7F2900F728011EFB0880A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.tedpella.com/histo_html/miltex-plunger-punch.aspx"}}}}
